elements.title: crudely designed mementos (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first silver dollars of the Republic of China were crudely designed mementos (example pictured)?

elements.title: Cécile Fatiman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Haitian Revolution began when Cécile Fatiman sacrificed a black pig, a ritual that was later repeated by Haitians resisting the United States occupation and the Duvalier dynasty?

elements.title: spearfishing event at the 2014 Micronesian Games (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a shark cost a competitor a silver medal in the spearfishing event at the 2014 Micronesian Games?

elements.title: the number 1 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the number 1 is its own square, square root, and factorial?

elements.title: Deep Cut Gardens (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Deep Cut Gardens in New Jersey contains a stone replica of Mount Vesuvius that once erupted smoke at the behest of mobster Vito Genovese?

elements.title: the Hillbilly Thomists (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Hillbilly Thomists, a band made up of friars from the Dominican Order, reached the number-two spot on Billboard's bluegrass chart?

elements.title: Pituamkek National Park Reserve (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Pituamkek National Park Reserve, Canada's newest national park, protects a chain of barrier islands that have been used for fishing and hunting by the Mi'kmaq for 4,000 years?

elements.title: Palace Theater light bulb (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Palace Theater light bulb has been running since 1908?

elements.title: two whales to the Great Salt Lake (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a sensational story in 1888 claimed that James Wickham, a British scientist, introduced two whales to the Great Salt Lake in an attempt to start a whale oil industry?
